fields.Title of Presentation: <span><span style="font-size:11pt;background-color:transparent;">Teaching Resource Evaluation Using Lateral Reading in Boise State University’s Research and Critical Inquiry Microcourse</span></span>
fields.Conference/Meeting Name: Annual Conference of the First Year Experience
fields.Sponsoring Organization: National Resource Center, First-Year Experience and Students in Transition, University of South Carolina
fields.Description/Abstract: <p>Research and Instruction librarians at Boise State University have incorporated a hand-graded lateral reading assignment into their asynchronous Research and Critical Inquiry Microcourse (RCIM). The RCIM is embedded in the University Foundations courses to introduce first year students to foundational information literacy concepts. This session will discuss the decision to support students’ critical inquiry development by teaching introductory lateral reading skills to evaluate information resources, as well as the benefit to students when they encounter these concepts at the earliest stages of their university experience. We will also discuss key takeaways after a year of grading the assignment.</p>
